quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Java is to JavaScript what car is to carpet.
author: Chris Heilmann

quote: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
author: Dan Salomon

quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: Fix the cause, not the symptom.
author: Steve Maguire

quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming.
author: Kent Beck

quote: When to use iterative development? You should use it for almost all development efforts.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

quote: Programming is learned by writing programs.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.
author: Jim Highsmith

quote: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Jeff Sickel

quote: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

quote: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

quote: You can’t trust code that you did not totally create yourself.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

quote: Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots.
author: Rick Cook

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: A good programmer is someone who looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

quote: In programming, the hard part isn’t solving problems, but deciding what problems to solve.
author: Paul Graham

quote: Don’t write better error messages, write code that doesn’t need them.
author: Jason C. McDonald

quote: You can’t have great software without a great team.
author: Jim McCarthy

quote: Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.
author: Nathan Myhrvold

quote: The most effective debugging tool is still careful thought, coupled with judiciously placed print statements.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature.
author: Rich Kulawiec

quote: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components are those that aren’t there.
author: Gordon Bell

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
author: Anonymous

quote: To understand recursion, one must first understand recursion.
author: Anonymous

quote: Software is like entropy: it is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases.
author: Norman Augustine

quote: The best performance improvement is the transition from the nonworking state to the working state.
author: John Ousterhout

quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
author: Seymour Cray

quote: There are only two hard things in Computer Science: cache invalidation and naming things.
author: Phil Karlton

quote: Programming is not easy like Sunday morning, it is silent poetry.
author: Waseem Latif

quote: A language that doesn’t affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

quote: Sometimes the elegant implementation is just a function. Not a method. Not a class. Not a framework. Just a function.
author: John Carmack

quote: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: Low-level programming is good for the programmer’s soul.
author: John Carmack

quote: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid, but because it is fun to program.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Nine people can’t make a baby in a month.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: A program that produces incorrect results twice as fast is infinitely slower.
author: John Osterhout

quote: There is no code faster than no code.
author: Kevlin Henney

quote: Good design adds value faster than it adds cost.
author: Thomas C. Gale

quote: The best programmers are not marginally better than merely good ones. They are an order-of-magnitude better.
author: Randall E. Stross

quote: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however, they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

quote: Simplicity carried to the extreme becomes elegance.
author: Jon Franklin

quote: Inside every large program, there is a small program trying to get out.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: Don’t document the problem, fix it.
author: Atli Björgvin Oddsson

quote: A good specification is a prescription for happiness.
author: David Parnas

quote: Testing shows the presence, not the absence of bugs.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: The fastest code is the code that never runs.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming isn’t about what you know; it’s about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: In theory, theory and practice are the same. In practice, they’re not.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: The sooner you start to code, the longer the program will take.
author: Roy Carlson

quote: Documentation is like sex: when it is good, it is very, very good; and when it is bad, it is better than nothing.
author: Dick Brandon

quote: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
author: Anonymous

quote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Code without tests is broken as designed.
author: Jacob Kaplan-Moss

quote: Software testing is a sport like hunting, it’s bug hunting.
author: Amit Kalantri

quote: The best programmers are not those who remember every line of syntax, but those who know how to find and use information.
author: Anonymous

quote: Complexity kills. It sucks the life out of developers, makes products difficult to plan, build, and test.
author: Ray Ozzie

quote: Good software, like wine, takes time.
author: Joel Spolsky

quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: A primary cause of complexity is that software vendors uncritically adopt almost any feature that users want.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: In programming, the most effective debugging tool is still careful thought.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Programming is the art of algorithm design and the craft of debugging errant code.
author: Ellen Ullman

quote: If you don’t handle errors, your users will.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best software is the one you don’t notice is there.
author: Anonymous

quote: Simplicity is hard to build, easy to use, and hard to charge for. Complexity is easy to build, hard to use, and easy to charge for.
author: Chris Sacca

quote: The best code is no code at all.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: Programming is the closest thing we have to magic.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best thing programmers can do for each other is to share their code.
author: Anonymous

quote: Simplicity is not the absence of complexity, but the art of managing it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code that is easy to delete is easier to maintain.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is breaking down problems into smaller problems until they become trivial to solve.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programs are like people, they get old and need to be replaced.
author: Paul Graham

quote: The art of debugging is figuring out what you really told your program to do rather than what you thought you told it.
author: Andrew Singer

quote: Programming languages are the medium through which programmers express ideas.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best software is simple, elegant, and invisible.
author: Anonymous

quote: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime drama where you are also the murderer.
author: Filippo Valsorda

quote: Don’t write code that works, write code that explains.
author: Anonymous

quote: Good software is a service. Bad software is a tax.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best programmers are constantly learning.
author: Anonymous

quote: The cleaner the code, the faster the development.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming isn’t about typing, it’s about thinking.
author: Rich Hickey

quote: The more code you write, the more bugs you create.
author: Anonymous

quote: A program is never less than 90% complete, and never more than 95% complete.
author: Terry Baker

quote: Programs grow faster than programmers’ ability to manage them.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best architectures are the ones you barely notice.
author: Anonymous

quote: Don’t repeat yourself. Every piece of knowledge must have a single, unambiguous, authoritative representation.
author: Andy Hunt

quote: Programming is thinking, not typing.
author: Casey Patton

quote: There is no such thing as a perfect program, only better ones.
author: Anonymous

quote: In coding, clarity is king.
author: Anonymous

quote: Your code should explain itself without needing a map.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is the art of telling another human being what one wants the computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: The best programmers build solutions, not just software.
author: Anonymous

quote: If you automate a mess, you get an automated mess.
author: Rod Michael

quote: Every program has at least one bug and at least one unnecessary feature.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is the ultimate expression of logic and creativity.
author: Anonymous

quote: All software has bugs. It’s just a question of whether you know about them or not.
author: Anonymous

quote: The most dangerous phrase in programming is: 'It works on my machine.'
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is the skill of controlling complexity.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best programmers write less code.
author: Anonymous

quote: Software is a mirror of the people who build it.
author: Anonymous

quote: A well-written program is poetry in logic.
author: Anonymous

quote: The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it.
author: Pamela Zave

quote: Programming is like puzzle-solving, except the puzzle is changing as you solve it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Simple code is harder to write than complex code, but it is worth it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Every bug you find is a lesson in humility.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code should be written as if the next person to maintain it is a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

quote: If you want to be a good programmer, write code. If you want to be a great programmer, read code.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is a journey, not a destination.
author: Anonymous

quote: The computer will do what you tell it to do, not what you want it to do.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best programs are simple tools that solve real problems.
author: Anonymous

quote: Complexity is the enemy of reliability.
author: Tony Hoare

quote: Programs are written to be read by humans and executed by machines.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming teaches you how to think clearly and logically.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code is read more often than it is written.
author: Guido van Rossum

quote: The best code is boring code.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is turning coffee into software.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code without purpose is like a story without an ending.
author: Anonymous

quote: In programming, naming things well is one of the hardest problems.
author: Anonymous

quote: Software should be designed for change because change is inevitable.
author: Anonymous

quote: Every line of code is a liability.
author: Anonymous

quote: Write programs that do one thing and do it well.
author: Doug McIlroy

quote: Programming requires patience, precision, and persistence.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can’t write perfect software, but you can write useful software.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is like writing: the more you do it, the better you get.
author: Anonymous

quote: The art of programming is the art of organizing complexity.
author: Anonymous

quote: Software is never finished, only abandoned.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programs should be written for clarity, not cleverness.
author: Anonymous

quote: The hardest bugs to find are the ones you introduced months ago.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is logic wrapped in creativity.
author: Anonymous

quote: Don’t optimize until you know it matters.
author: Anonymous

quote: A programmer is a problem solver with a keyboard.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code should be self-explanatory and self-documenting.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is teaching a computer how to think, step by step.
author: Anonymous

quote: A great program is like a great story: clear, engaging, and memorable.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is the intersection of science, art, and craft.
author: Anonymous

quote: Good programmers write code for people first, machines second.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code should be simple enough to explain to a beginner.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is solving problems in ways you didn’t know you could.
author: Anonymous

quote: The key to programming is abstraction and composition.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is like gardening: you must constantly prune and care for your code.
author: Anonymous

quote: Every good program starts with a clear idea.
author: Anonymous

quote: Code is communication, not just computation.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best programs are the ones that disappear into the background.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is like building a city: structure matters.
author: Anonymous
